1.label: Lifeline
1.description: Reports the device status and allows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).

2.label: On/Off S1
2.description: On/Off (S1) is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Basic command class)

3.label: Dimmer S1
3.description: “Dimmer (S1)” is assigned to switch connected to the S1 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)

4.label: On/Off S2
4.description: On/Off (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Basic command class)

5.label: Dimmer S2
5.description: Dimmer (S2) is assigned to switch connected to the S2 terminal (uses Switch Multilevel command class)

options.label: State NOT saved at power failure, all outputs are set to OFF upon power restore
State saved at power failure, all outputs are set to previous state upon power restore

10.label: First channel - operating mode
10.description: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.

11.label: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
11.description: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal.

options.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

12.label: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
12.description: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

13.label: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode
13.description:
This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode.
                1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

15.label: Second channel - operating mode
15.description: This parameter allows to choose operating for the 2nd channel controlled by the S2 switch.

16.label: Second channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
16.description: This parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S2 terminal.

options.label: Cancel mode and set target state
No reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
Reset timer - start counting from the beginning

17.label: Second channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
17.description: This parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes. (s)

18.label: Second channel - pulse time for flashing mode
18.description:
This parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode.
                1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step)

options.label: Toggle switch (contact closed - On, contact opened - OFF)
Toggle switch (device changes status when switch changes status)

21.label: Flashing mode report
21.description: Enabled / Disabled reports on Flashing mode

27.label: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
27.description:
This parameter defines how commands are sent to specified association groups: as secure or non-secure.
                Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode.
                This parameter does not apply to 1st lifeline group.
                1 - 2nd group sent as secure.
                2 - 3rd group sent as secure.
                4 - 4th group sent as secure.
                8 - 5th group sent as secure.
                Default setting: 15 (all)

28.label: S1 switch - scenes sent
28.description:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them.
                1 - Key pressed 1 time.
                2 - Key pressed 2 times.
                4 - Key pressed 3 times.
                8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released.
                Default setting: 0 (none)

options.label: Key Hold Down and Key Released
In all cases a scene ID will be sent

29.label: S2 switch - scenes sent
29.description:
This parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them.
                1 - Key pressed 1 time.
                2 - Key pressed 2 times.
                4 - Key pressed 3 times.
                8 - Key Hold Down and Key Released.
                Default setting: 0 (none)

options.label: Key Hold Down and Key Released
In all cases a scene ID will be sent

30.label: S1 associations sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
30.description:
This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.
                All actions are active by default.
                1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch.
                2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch.
                4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch.
                8 - ignore double click of the switch.
                Default setting: 0

options.label: All actions are active by default
ignore turning ON with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

31.label: S1 Switch ON value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
31.description: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

32.label: S1 Switch OFF value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
32.description: This parameter determines value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

33.label: S1 Switch Double Click value sent to 2nd and 3rd association groups
33.description: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 2nd and 3rd association group.

35.label: S2 associations sent to 4th and 5th association groups
35.description:
This parameter determines which actions are ignored when sending commands to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.
                All actions are active by default.
                1 - ignore turning On with 1 click of the switch.
                2 - ignore turning OFF with 1 click of the switch.
                4 - ignore holding and releasing the switch.
                8 - ignore double click of the switch.
                Default setting: 0

options.label: All actions are active by default
ignore turning on with 1 click of the switch
ignore turning off with 1 click of the switch
ignore holding and releasing the switch
ignore double click of the switch

36.label: S2 Switch ON value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
36.description: This parameter determines value sent with Switch On command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

37.label: S2 Switch OFF value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
37.description: This parameter determines value sent with Switch Off command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

38.label: S2 Switch Double Click value sent to 4th and 5th association groups
38.description: This parameter determines value sent with Double Click command to devices associated in 4th and 5th association group.

40.label: Reaction to General Alarm
40.description: This parameter determines how the device will react to General Alarm frame.

41.label: Reaction to Flood Alarm
41.description: This parameter determines how the device will react to Flood Alarm frame.

42.label: Reaction to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm
42.description: This parameter determines how the device will react to CO/CO2/Smoke Alarm frame.

43.label: Reaction to Heat Alarm
43.description: This parameter determines how the device will react to Heat alarm frame.

44.label: Flashing alarm duration
44.description:
This parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode.
                1-32000 (0.1-32000s, 1s step) Default: 600 (10min)

50.label: First channel - power reports
50.description:
This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power
                that will result in sending new power report to the main controller.
                1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

51.label: First channel - minimal time between power reports
51.description:
This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before
                sending new power report to the main controller.
                1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

53.label: First channel - energy reports
53.description:
This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy
                that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller.
                1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

54.label: Second Channel - power reports
54.description:
This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed power
                that will result in sending new power report to the main controller.
                1-100 (%) Default 20 (20%)

55.label: Second channel - minimal time between power reports
55.description:
This parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before
                sending new power report to the main controller.
                1-120 (s) Default 10 (10s)

57.label: Second channel - energy reports
57.description:
This parameter determines the minimum change in consumed energy
                that will result in sending new energy report to the main controller
                1-32000 (0.01-320 kWh) Default 100 (1kWh)

58.label: Periodic power reports
58.description:
This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic
                power reports are sent to the main controller.
                1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

59.label: Periodic energy reports
59.description:
This parameter determines in what time interval the periodic
                power reports are sent to the main controller.
                1-32000 (s) Default 3600 (1h)

60.label: Measuring energy consumed by the device itself
60.description:
This parameter determines whether energy metering should include
                the amount of energy consumed by the device itself. Results are
                being added to energy reports for first endpoint.
